image.altText: An Indigenous woman sits on a walking frame in a gallery space. Colourful ceramic pots are in front of her.

props.synopsis: Between treatments, Purple House patients have been creating colourful works of ceramic art. The results are now on display in Alice Springs.

title.children: Ceramic work of remote dialysis patients on display in Alice Springs

image.altText: Three police officers standing around an Indigenous man in a wheelchair, at community markets.

props.synopsis: Body-worn video footage played to the Darwin Local Court captures a loud thud as an Aboriginal man with a disability is dropped into a police wagon, drawing an audible gasp from another officer.

title.children: NT police officer assaulted Aboriginal man in wheelchair, court rules

image.altText: Jacinta Nampijinpa Price

props.synopsis: The Jacinta Nampijinpa Price saga is a chink in Sussan Ley's armour and at the very least has handed Labor damaging material for their 2028 election campaign.

title.children: A Nampijinpa Price-sized chink in Ley's armour and an Albanese fashion faux pas

image.altText: A big crab pictured tied from his claws to its body by a tight green rope and held

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory's mud crab industry will temporarily shut down after a fisheries assessment found stock numbers had fallen below a "trigger point".Â

title.children: NT mud crabs off Christmas menu as industry closes for three months

image.altText: A woman smiles at the camera.

props.synopsis: A study will work with Indigenous researchers who will map cultural assets and integrate traditional healing to improve outcomes in remote centres.

title.children: Researcher wants First Nations suicide prevention put 'in our hands'

image.altText: Politician looks ahead at press conference

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory chief minister is spending her first overseas trip spruiking the NT's ability to host hundreds of Japanese Self-Defense Force soldiers each year.

title.children: NT leader flies to Japan in bid to draw defence troops to Darwin

image.altText: People marching for NAIDOC Rally. One lady holds a sign that reads 'Treaty Now'.

props.synopsis: For Aboriginal people, it has been centuries in the making. As Victoria tables legislation for the country's first treaty with First Nations people, Indigenous leaders are urging other states and territories to follow suit.

title.children: First Nations leaders applaud Australia's first treaty centuries in the making

image.altText: A man with dark hair and a beard, standing with his arms crossed.

props.synopsis: Fifteen years after it was first earmarked for "pedestrian infrastructure", a 1 kilometre-long road in Darwin's north remains dangerously underdeveloped, according to residents and local politicians.

title.children: Urgent calls for overdue upgrades on dangerous Darwin road

image.altText: A white land cruiser is smashed by a large tree that has been uprooted by wind

props.synopsis: Strong winds uprooted trees, with branches and entire trunks landing on cars and roads when a storm hit Alice Springs.

title.children: Residents clean up after surprise storm lashes Alice Springs

image.altText: Gloved hands prepare a needle for vaccination.

props.synopsis: Health officials in Cairns publish a list of potential measles exposure sites after a locally acquired case of the illness.

title.children: Bali travellers urged to get vaccinated amid new measles outbreak

image.altText: Donald Trump and Charlie Kirk shake hands on stage

props.synopsis: Charlie Kirk rose from a teenage conservative campus activist to a top podcaster, culture warrior and ally of US President Donald Trump.Â

title.children: Who was Charlie Kirk, the conservative activist and Trump ally?

image.altText: An illustration of an egg being inseminated, viewed under a microscope.

props.synopsis: Shocking allegations of suspected embezzlement at the fertility industry's peak body have been revealed just days before Australia's health ministers meet to decide the future of how the organisation self-regulates the IVF sector.

title.children: Allegations of suspected $3m fraud rock IVF industry

image.altText: Marty Sheargold wearing headphones and speaking on air for Triple M, he has a bald head, greying moustache and beard.

title.children: Sheargold's 'sexist' Matildas remarks breached decency rules

image.altText: Julie Bishop looks serious at a press conference.

props.synopsis: In the wake of ANU vice-chancellor Genevieve Bell's resignation, Chancellor Julie Bishop says there's no reason for her to also stand aside.

title.children: Julie Bishop says 'no grounds' for her to resign as ANU chancellor

image.altText: Larry Ellison sitting in a room at the White House

props.synopsis: The switch in the ranking comes after a blockbuster earnings report from Oracle, powered by multi-billion-dollar orders from customers as the AI race heats up.

title.children: Larry Ellison briefly overtakes Elon Musk as world's richest person

image.altText: Men in military camo with black balaclavas, green headbands and assault rifles stand in a line

props.synopsis: Since October 7, 2023 Hamas has lost its most senior leaders and military organisation, but two years in, it has preserved some capacity to keep fighting Israeli troops and remain the dominant force inside Gaza.

title.children: Israel's goal is to destroy Hamas. Here is what the group has left

image.altText: Slices of body parts covered in Perspex and put on display on walls.

props.synopsis: A Tasmanian coroner has released his findings from an investigation into 177 human specimens held in the collection of a university museum without the consent or knowledge of families.

title.children: Body parts taken without consent for museum display, coroner finds

image.altText: Russian President Vladimir Putin smiles

props.synopsis: If you thought a ceasefire between Russia and Ukraine was within reach â as Donald Trump has suggested â let the events in Poland this week be a wake-up call: it's not.

title.children: This Poland attack tells us Putin has no plans to do a peace deal

image.altText: Gout Gout of Queensland celebrates after winning a track race, yelling and raising his arms wide

props.synopsis: Usain Bolt delivers a simple piece of advice to Gout Gout as the Australian teenage sprint sensation prepares for his first world championships.

title.children: 'It's never just easy': Usain Bolt's message to Gout Gout ahead of world titles debut

image.altText: A woman looks at the camera with a blank expression.

props.synopsis: Robert Karl Huber is sentenced to 12 years in prison over the death of his partner Lindy Lucena in Ballina in 2023.

title.children: Daughter tells court of 'bravest person I know' as mum's attacker jailed

image.altText: A grey-haired, middle-aged man behind a cage in a police van.

image.altText: A tornado making landfall in a rural area

props.synopsis: The major drenching is unusual for early spring and resulted in Sydney's wettest September day since 1879.

title.children: Tornadoes in NSW not unusual, but September rain heaviest in 146 years

image.altText: A bald man, smiling, in a chequered shirt.

props.synopsis: A small community on South Australia's Lower Eyre Peninsula has paid tribute to Jarred Wait, who died in an agricultural plane crash at Cummins.

title.children: Community mourns young father after fatal Eyre Peninsula plane crash

image.altText: A hand holds a smart phone, showing Jennie on an Instagram feed holding a lipstick.

props.synopsis: Once considered niche, K-beauty products are now everywhere â from luxury department stores to local pharmacies and even supermarkets. It is one of the fastest-growing sectors in the Australian cosmetics landscape.Â

title.children: South Korea's skincare innovation attracts shoppers and Australian brands

image.altText: a close-up of a person holding a glass under a running tap, filling it with water

props.synopsis: A report has found Sydney Water did not perform an "appropriate level of due diligence" before it claimed in June 2024 there were no known PFAS hotspots within its drinking water catchments.

title.children: Sydney Water under fire over 'forever chemical' hotspots in city

image.altText: Man has a serious expression as he sits in front of a radio microphone. He has shoulder length brown hair and wears a cap.

props.synopsis: When AFL player Mitch Brown openly came out as the first bisexual man in AFL history, he wasn't expecting the guilt that followed. While the 36-year-old has "no regrets", he admits he's disappointed by the lack of support from some within the AFL.

title.children: 'I'll walk with you': Mitch Brown's message to next queer AFL player

image.altText: Aerial view of the bubble curtain showing an area of ocean with a white bubble ring

props.synopsis: A "bubble curtain" is set for activation as part of South Australia's fight against the ongoing algal bloom, as the state government defends its handling of health advice.

title.children: 'Bubble curtain' ready for use as SA's algal bloom persists

image.altText: An image of Michael Pell.

props.synopsis: Former AFL umpire Michael Pell leaked information about confidential Brownlow Medal votes and used another manâs account to place bets on the marquee event, police allege.

title.children: AFL umpire faces court over alleged Brownlow betting scam

image.altText: The Gap arrest

props.synopsis: Police allegedly found violent extremist material linked to a proscribed terror organisation during a search of the 18-year-old's property.

title.children: Brisbane man accused of terrorism offences granted bail

image.altText: Jess Fox in a screenshot from her Instagram story announcing she will miss the Canoe Slalom World Championships.

props.synopsis: For the first time since 2010, Australian Olympic gold medallist Jess Fox will miss the Canoe Slalom World Championships, being held later this month on her home course.

title.children: Jess Fox 'heartbroken' as she is forced to miss home world championships

image.altText: Courtroom sketch of a man with a bald head and a beard looking sad

props.synopsis: The trial against a South Australian man accused of murder has been vacated after a jury member allegedly googled information, a court has heard.

title.children: Mistrial declared in alleged murder case after juror googled information, court hears

image.altText: A small blue-headed wren sitting in paperbark tree.

props.synopsis: The ACT's superb fairy-wren population has declined by 60 per cent since counting began in the 1980s, but this last winter the figures were even worse, new research has revealed.

title.children: For 40 years researchers have counted fairy-wrens â 2025 was 'confronting'

image.altText: A split image with a Hawthorn defender taking a pack mark and a Gold Coast player pumping his fist in celebration.

props.synopsis: Hawthorn and Gold Coast go into their cut-throat semifinals with reasons for some confidence against the Crows and Lions. Cody Atkinson and Sean Lawson look into the factors driving both teams' September runs.

title.children: What the Hawks and Suns must do to score an AFL prelim final

image.altText: Molly Picklum holds up an Australia flag in the water

props.synopsis: With the stakes and swell continually rising, surfer Molly Picklum can't help but laugh when she entertains the idea of matching Steph Gilmore's title haul.

title.children: Picklum's quest for multiple surfing titles 'a trip' in modern era

image.altText: pink soap scum on bathroom tiles being scrubbed

props.synopsis: Have you ever noticed a pink or orange-coloured substance in the tile grout or around taps in your bathroom? In most cases, it's one of two things.

title.children: Is the pink soap scum in my bathroom mould, or something else?
